content:
I'd be happy to help you visualize your travel history! Unfortunately, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your personal travel records or data. However, I can suggest a few options to help you track and visualize your travel history:

1. **Google Timeline**: If you have a Google account and have location history enabled on your devices, you can use Google Timeline to view your travel history. It will show you a map of the places you've been, including dates and times. You can access Google Timeline by going to the Google Maps website, clicking on the menu icon (three horizontal lines), and selecting "Your Timeline."
2. **TripIt**: TripIt is a travel planning app that allows you to track your trips and visualize your travel history. You can connect your email accounts, and TripIt will automatically import your travel itineraries. You can then view your travel history on a calendar or map.
3. **Manual tracking**: If you don't have access to your past travel records, you can try manually tracking your travel history. Create a calendar or spreadsheet and mark the dates of your trips. You can add details like destinations, modes of transportation, and trip types (e.g., business or leisure).

Since you're about to embark on a family vacation to Denver, Colorado, I hope you have a safe and enjoyable trip! Don't forget to pack essentials like sunscreen, comfortable shoes, and a camera to capture those Rocky Mountain memories.

Remember, you can always come back to this conversation and provide more details about your travel history if you'd like to discuss it further. Safe travels!
